description: Metadata schema for C-MAIKI biological samples with conditional field rendering

fields.definition: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized.
fields.validation_description: Must be a non-empty string containing only letters, numbers, and underscores.

fields.definition: Description of the project.
fields.example: Microbial diversity survey along the Waimea Supertransect in Hawaii.
fields.validation_description: Must be a non-empty string

fields.definition: Primary person responsible for this sample or dataset
fields.validation_description: Must be a non-empty string

fields.definition: Email address for the primary point of contact.
fields.validation_description: Must be a valid email address format (e.g., user@domain.com)

fields.definition: Alternate person who can answer questions about this sample or dataset
Email address for the secondary point of contact.
fields.validation_description: Must be a valid email address format (e.g., user@domain.com)

fields.definition: Person who can provide sequencing run details
Email address for the sequencing point of contact.
fields.validation_description: Must be a valid email address format (e.g., user@domain.com)

fields.definition: A unique name used to identify an individual sample.
fields.validation_description: Must be a non-empty string containing only letters, numbers, and underscores. Must be unique across all samples.

fields.definition: The start date of sampling in YYYY-MM-DD format.
fields.validation_description: Must be a valid date in YYYY-MM-DD format

fields.definition: The end date of sampling for interval collections in YYYY-MM-DD format. Leave blank for single-day collections.
fields.validation_description: Must be a valid date in YYYY-MM-DD format that is equal to or after the collection date

fields.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name followed by specific region name.
fields.example: Atlantic Ocean:Charlie Gibbs Fracture Zone, USA: Hawaii, Honolulu, USA: Hawaii, Waimea Valley
fields.validation_description: Must be a non-empty string

fields.definition: Latitude of collection site
fields.validation_description: Must be a decimal number (latitude format), with optional negative signs

fields.definition: Longitude of collection site
fields.validation_description: Must be a decimal number (longitude format), with optional negative signs

fields.definition: For projects with multiple PIs (i.e., different samples may belong to various labs)
fields.validation_description: Must be a non-empty string

fields.definition: The type of material from which the sample was obtained
fields.validation_description: Must be a non-empty string

fields.definition: A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from the environment, or a link to the protocol
fields.example: filtering of seawater, storing samples in ethanol, freeze drying
fields.validation_description: Optional text field, any string value is acceptable

fields.definition: EMP Ontology level 1 (Organism lifestyle): Free-living, Host-associated, Control, Not applicable, Unknown
fields.validation_description: Must be one of the predefined options

fields.definition: EMP Ontology level 2 (Categories of empo_1): Saline, Non-saline, Animal, Plant, Fungus, Positive, Negative, Contradictory, Missing, Not applicable
fields.validation_description: Must be one of the options, this field is determined by EMPO Level 1 selection (dynamic dropdown)
Must be one of the options determined by EMPO Level 2 selection (dynamic dropdown)

fields.definition: The major environmental system (biome) that the sample derived from
options: Area Of Developed Space With High Usage Intensity
Area Of Developed Space With Low Usage Intensity
Area Of Developed Space With Medium Usage Intensity
Area Of Gramanoid Or Herbaceous Vegetation
Area Of Sedge- And Forb-Dominated Herbaceous Vegetation
Tropical Lowland Evergreen Broadleaf Rain Forest
fields.validation_description: Must be one of the predefined options

fields.definition: Any nearby environmental features which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample (countable entities)
options: Area Of Developed Space With High Usage Intensity
Area Of Developed Space With Low Usage Intensity
Area Of Developed Space With Medium Usage Intensity
Area Of Gramanoid Or Herbaceous Vegetation
Area Of Sedge- And Forb-Dominated Herbaceous Vegetation
Tropical Lowland Evergreen Broadleaf Rain Forest
fields.validation_description: Must be one of the predefined options

fields.definition: Any relevant environmental material immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling (non-countable entities)
options: Codex Alimentarius Classification Of Food And Feed Commodities
European Union Agency Food Product Type
U.S. Code Of Federal Regulations, Title 21 Food Product Type
A.  Primary Food Commodities Of Plant Origin (Ccpr)
Congelation Ice In A Fresh Water Body
Extract, Concentrate Or Isolate Of Plant Or Animal
Fermented Fish Or Seafood Food Product
Fermenting Elaeis Palm Sap Food Product
Fruit Butter, Jelly, Preserve Or Related Product (Us Cfr)
Material Primarily Composed Of Biogenic Carbonates
Milk Or Milk Based Food Product
Milk Or Milk Product Analog (Us Cfr)
New Zealand Cheddar Cheese Food Product
Plant Based Refined Or Partially-Refined Food Product
Plant Fat Or Oil Refined Food Product
Plant Fruit As Vegetable Food Product
Plant Seed Based Bakery Food Product
Plant Seed Or Nut Food Product
Plant Stem Or Spear Food Product
Sea Water Fish Egg Food Product
Vacherin Mont Dor Cheese Food Product
fields.validation_description: Must be one of the predefined options

fields.description: Report the host's taxonomic name and/or NCBI taxonomy ID
fields.validation_description: Must be a non-empty string when EMPO Level 1 is set to 'host-associated'
Must be a non-empty string when EMPO Level 1 is set to 'host-associated'
Must be one of the predefined host diet options when EMPO Level 1 is set to 'host-associated'

fields.example: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource, or a standard operating procedure (SOP) that describes the extraction protocol (refer to Point of Contact)
fields.validation_description: Optional text field, any string value is acceptable

fields.definition: Name/identifier for the forward primer
fields.validation_description: Must be a non-empty string

fields.definition: Forward primer sequence reported in the 5' to 3' direction
fields.validation_description: Must be uppercase letters only (A, T, C, G, and IUPAC ambiguity codes)

fields.definition: Name/identifier for the reverse primer
fields.validation_description: Must be a non-empty string

fields.definition: Reverse primer sequence reported in the 5' to 3' direction
fields.validation_description: Must be uppercase letters only (A, T, C, G, and IUPAC ambiguity codes)

fields.definition: Molecular barcode (MID) attached to the 5' end of the forward strand to uniquely tag samples in a sequencing run. Sequence reported in 5' to 3' direction
fields.validation_description: Must be uppercase letters only (A, T, C, G, and IUPAC ambiguity codes). Sequence reported in 5' to 3' direction

fields.definition: Molecular barcode (MID) attached to the 3' end of the reverse strand to uniquely tag samples in a sequencing run. Sequence reported in 5' to 3' direction
fields.validation_description: Must be uppercase letters only (A, T, C, G, and IUPAC ambiguity codes). Sequence reported in 5' to 3' direction
Must be a non-empty string. Does not have to be a dropdown option
Optional field that must be one of the predefined options: Single, Paired, or Other if provided

fields.example: University of Hawaii ASGPB, UC Berkeley DNA Sequencing Facility
fields.validation_description: Optional text field, any string value is acceptable
Must be a non-empty string. Does not have to be a dropdown option
Optional text field, any string value is acceptable
